instruction:
Can you please provide me the names of the two players in the atomic bomb game (in go)? 

If you can get me the referee's name as well, that's even better!
output:
The Atomic Bomb Game was a famous Go match played in 1983 between two legendary players: Cho Chikun and Sakata Eio. The referee for this match was Kato Masao.

The game was named the Atomic Bomb Game because of the speed at which the players played. The game lasted only 20 minutes, and both players played very aggressively, making it seem like an atomic bomb had been dropped on the board.

The game is considered one of the most exciting and memorable games in the history of Go. It's a must-watch for any Go enthusiast.
